intro: Blakea asplundii, commonly known as the asplundii bower vine, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. Blakea asplundii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses due to its vibrant blooms and vigorous growth.
